# King's Park Secondary School

| established             = 1962
| motto                   = Believe achieve
(Former Motto: Video Meliora Petoque)
| type                    = Secondary
| head_label              = Head Teacher
| head                    = Kirsty Ayed
| lower_age               = 11
| upper_age               = 18
| address                 = 14 Fetlar Drive
| city                    = Glasgow
| county                  = Lanarkshire
| country                 = Scotland
| postcode                = G44 5BL
| local_authority         = Glasgow City Council
| staff                   = 100 Full-time staff
| enrolment               = 900
| gender                  = Coeducational
| houses                  = Arran, Lewis, Mull, Skye
| accreditations          = SQA
| colours                 =  blue, green
| feeder_schools          = Croftfoot Primary School, King's Park Primary School, Mount Florida Primary, Toryglen Primary School, and the catchment areas of the former Simshill Primary School and Holmlea Primary School (now part of Merrylee Primary School).
| publication             =
| website                 = http://www.kingspark-sec.glasgow.sch.uk
}}
'''King's Park Secondary School''', on Fetlar Drive, in the King's Park area (or specifically in the Simshill area) of south Glasgow, is a Scottish non-denominational state school. It was established in 1962.
Former pupils
* Gordon Brown, author
* Gerry Cinnamon, singer-songwriter
* Willie Donachie, footballer
* Bobby Gillespie, musician
* James Harkness, actor
* Rory Hughes, rugby player
* Ross Irwin, footballer
* Jane McCarry, actress
* Alan McGee, businessman
References
